conclusion: Analyze liquid flow from A, B, C through baffles to determine which container (D or E) it will end up in.
Three points (A, B, C) at the top where liquid will flow from; multiple colored baffles/barriers positioned at various angles; two containers (D, E) at the bottom where liquid will collect.
Liquid from A will flow downward and hit the gray baffle, angled diagonally down and to the left.
Liquid from A will be directed toward the left side and likely reach container D.
Liquid from B will flow downward and encounter the light blue/turquoise baffle, angled diagonally down and to the right.
Liquid from B will be directed toward the right side and likely reach container E.
Liquid from C will flow downward and may hit the light blue/turquoise baffle or other baffles like the black one.
Liquid from C will be directed rightward and likely reach container E.
Liquid from point A will flow into container D; liquid from points B and C will flow into container E.
